item.title: Five Years After The Vin Diesel Reveal, I’m Not Convinced Ark 2 Is Ever Coming Out
item.content:encoded:
It was a standout moment at The Game Awards 2020 showcase. Ark: Survival Evolved was only three years old and a sequel was coming. More importantly, it starred Vin Diesel in one of the most unforgettable CGI renderings of a human face ever put on screen. Five years later, though, Ark 2 is still nowhere in sight and another big delay means it won’t be released until over a decade after the first game at the earliest.

At least if you believe it’s still coming out at all. I’m less convinced with each fresh setback. Studio Wildcard cofounder Jeremy Stieglitz revealed at publisher Snail Games’ investor day this week that the new timeline for release is 2028. There’s instead a big update for the existing game coming in late 2027 that will reportedly serve as an introduction to some of the new mechanics and story beats coming in Ark 2.

“Legacy of Santiago is going to involve a lot of the new fighting and combat mechanics that we want to experiment with, with ARK 2: Soulslike third-person combat, melee combat, and so forth,” Stieglitz said in an interview on the Epic Games Store. “But it’s not going to have all this, like, crazy narrative world build-out content that we want to do with ARK 2, if the mechanics seem to work well with Legacy of Santiago, then the key selling point of ARK 2 could be that there is this giant campaign narrative that sits as a standalone product.”

But plans can change, as they’ve repeatedly done since Ark 2‘s original announcement. The game was first set to launch in 2023. Then it was pushed to an Early Access release in 2024. That year came and went with no updates. Earlier this year, Stieglitz said in an interview that he hoped it would arrive in Early Access by 2027 instead. Less than six months later, it’s now coming in 2028. Vin Diesel’s role in the game, which at one point included actually helping to create it, has also been, shall we say, fluid.

Ark: Survival Evolved is currently working with The Boys star Karl Urban, and he might end up taking on a bigger role in Ark 2 as well. Vin Diesel’s involvement remains harder to pin down. “The question is: How much performance are we going to get from him?” Stieglitz said this week. “Are we going to get one day, five days, eight hours? You don’t know. And the scope of how much performance we are going to get determines just how the narrative is going to play out. We have a narrative that’s, if we get a lot of Vin Diesel, this is what we will do, and if we get a little Vin Diesel, this is what we will do.”

item.title: Google Clears Out the Fitbit Inspire 3 at Its Lowest Price Ever After Pixel Tablet, Watch, and Buds Deals
item.content:encoded:
If you’re ready to start your fitness journey for 2026, it’s time to lock in and get something to help you meet those goals. And if you don’t want to hire a coach or a trainer to do that, you can go for something that might even help you a bit more: a fitness tracker. It can help you keep an eye on your heart rate, steps taken, sleep quality, and much more.

It’s a good way to see your progress, even if you don’t feel like you’re making any. We’ve found one that you can not only rely on for your daily workout tracking and other fitness needs, but one that’ll save you a significant amount of money.

The Fitbit Inspire 3 Health & Fitness Tracker is up for grabs at a discounted price at Amazon right now, and you can snag it. The Fitbit Inspire 3 Health & Fitness Tracker. It’s just $70, down from its usual price of $100. That’s a discount of $30 and 30% off.

See at Amazon

A useful, feature-rich fitness tracker for meeting your health goals

One of the things users appreciate right away about the Fitbit Inspire 3 is how intuitive it is to use. It has a bright display that you can see great in the dark as well, so even if you want to go out to the gym at night, you’ll be good to go. It’s also able to sync up with your favorite fitness apps so you can access all your important workout data from your phone. That and all of the information gathered via sensors. It’s always useful to know whether you’re getting a good night’s sleep or not.

Battery life on the Inspire 3 is solid and keeps you going for several days on a single charge. You don’t have to think about plugging it in and keeping it going at night, and you can just get up and go in the morning to start your day. That kind of regularity can keep you going back to do all your workouts without having an excuse to stay at home because your Fitbit hasn’t finished charging.

It’s really simple. If you want to work on your fitness, you should invest in a wearable that can help you keep track of everything that’s important to you and keeping your body healthy. Fitbit Inspire 3 Health & Fitness Tracker makes staying active and mindful more rewarding. And if you want to reach those New Year’s resolutions, this is absolutely going to help you do that.

item.title: Anker’s 67W USB-C Charger Is Going for Peanuts and Is About the Size of AirPods Pro, Order Now to Get It Before Christmas
item.content:encoded:
Carrying a separate charger for all your devices – from smartphones to laptops, tablets, earbuds, and smartwatches – can be inconvenient, especially if you’re trying to travel light. This is where a multi-port charger can come in handy, and today is a great time to grab one.

Anker makes some of the best portable charging solutions around, as right now, you can snap its 67W Anker Prime USB-C charger with 3 ports for just $37 at Amazon. That’s after a nice 25% discount. The offer is open to both Prime and non-Prime members, plus shipping is free for all shoppers!

See at Amazon

Power Multiple Devices at Once

It’s a compact block that’s around 51% smaller than the original 67W MacBook charger. The prongs fold in when not in use, which makes the thing quite easy (and safe) to carry around with you on the go. Small size doesn’t mean a compromise on performance, though.

The charger comes with a total of three ports, including 2 USB-C ports and 1 USB-A port. These are enough to juice all your essentials up at the same time, whether it’s your phone, laptop, or headphones. Connecting a single device lets you enjoy an efficient output of 67W, while the 65W max two-port charging cuts down on charging time by up to 34%. You won’t have to stay tethered to an outlet for long, even when powering multiple devices at the same time. The maximum output of 65W is available whether you’re using both USB-C ports or a mix of USB-C and USB-A. Compatibility-wise, the charger plays nicely with a wide range of devices, from iPhone Series 12 to 17, Samsung Galaxy phones, MacBooks, Pixel phones, iPads, and more.

Stability comes from the combination of partially covered pins and an innovative stacked design that keeps the charger firmly in place. GaNPrime Tech, paired with an upgraded ActiveShield 2.0 system, allows for better heat management and increased security, so you won’t have to worry about dealing with overheating, either.

We highly recommend this charger to anyone who is looking for a no-fuss power solution that can juice multiple devices at once. It’s going to be a great addition to work stations. The compact size makes it just as easy to carry around; simply plug it into an outlet in a cafe, coworking space, or the airport, and keep your devices up and running. This deal brings its price down to just $37, which is nothing considering the convenience and peace of mind it gets you. The box comes with the charger itself, a welcome guide, and a worry-free 24-month warranty for some extra peace of mind.

Getting your orders in today will help get the charger delivered before Christmas, which is great if you’re planning to go on a well-deserved trip during the holidays, and don’t want to carry multiple adapters for a bunch of gadgets.
